reasoning: Extremely rare autosomal dominant disorder with juvenile-onset hyperuricemia and progressive renal failure. Caused by UMOD gene mutations. <0.01 per 100k based on genetic registry data and case reports.
source: Hart TC et al. (2002). Mutations of the UMOD gene are responsible for medullary cystic kidney disease 2 and familial juvenile hyperuricaemic nephropathy. J Med Genet. 39(12):882-892
